definition: to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover

sentences.english: He succeeded in his profession, but he always secretly considered himself an impostor.
sentences.chinese: 他在专业方面很成功，但他常暗自认为是个冒牌货。

sentences.english: eg: The phony managed to slide over the questions which were difficult for him to answer.
sentences.chinese: 那个冒牌货设法避开了那些他难回答的问题。

sentences.english: These sheets I've bought are a cheat, they are too short for the bed.
sentences.chinese: 那些我买的床单是冒牌货，它们铺在床上太短。

sentences.english: But the majority of designer products sold in Iran are fake.
sentences.chinese: 不过，那里卖的设计师品牌，绝大多数都是冒牌货。

sentences.english: That doesn’t mean that your whole life has been a fraud (see: how to not sell out).
sentences.chinese: 但也不意味着你整个人生就是个冒牌货。

definition: to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
lit. to steal a rafter and replace it with a column/to replace the original with a fake/to perpetrate a fraud (idiom)
to steal sb's valuable item and substitute a similar-looking but worthless item/to sell a fake for the genuine article/to palm off
replacement guaranteed if not genuine/fig. authentic
genuine goods at fair prices/(fig.) genuine/real/true
to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)
malign agent who manipulates from behind the scenes/hidden hand
